title.native: デ・ジ・キャラットにょ

description:
Di Gi Charat (a.k.a. Dejiko) - along with Petit Charat (a.k.a. Puchiko) and Gema - travels to Earth as part of her training to become a full-fledged princess. They crash on a small town in Japan, where they meet the Omocha brothers (who spend most of their time thinking how cute Puchiko is) and Mr. & Mrs. Ankoro (an elderly couple that makes Japanese sweets).

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

tags.name: Space Opera
tags.description: Centers around space warfare, advanced technology, chivalric romance and adventure.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Crossover
tags.description: Centers around the placement of two or more otherwise discrete fictional characters, settings, or universes into the context of a single story.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Fishing
tags.description: Centers around the sport of fishing.

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/sawashiro-miyuki.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miyuki_Sawashiro) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B2%A2%E5%9F%8E%E3%81%BF%E3%82%86%E3%81%8D)

Began her voice-acting career in 1999 and has continued her work as a seiyuu for more than two decades. Her younger brother [Chiharu Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/120159) is a fellow voice actor.

__Non-anime roles:__~!
• Aggie in "Madeline" (live-action movie)
• Agrias Oaks in "Dissidia Final Fantasy: Opera Omnia" (Smartphone VG) 
• Akane in "ZERO ESCAPE: Jikan no Dilemma" (VG)
• Allie Nodens in "7th Dragon III Code: VFD" (VG)
• Anika in "HIT ～Heroes of Incredible Tales～" 
• Aranea Highwind in "Final Fantasy XV" (VG)
• Archer (Artemis) in "Fate/Grand Order" (VG)
• Aruruu in "Utawarerumono" (VG)
• Aya in "Assassin's Creed: Origins" (VG)
• Azel in "Rune Factory Oceans" (VG)
• Banshinatari in "Granado Espada" (MMORPG) 
• Barbara Gordon / Batgirl in "The Lego Batman Movie" (animated movie)
• Barcia in "The Lost Child" (VG)
• Beelzebub in "J-Stars Victory VS" (VG)
• Berserker (Florence Nightingale) in "Fate/Grand Order" (VG)
• Cal 'Drei' Devens in "Phantom of Inferno" (2011) (VG)
• Camilla in "Fire Emblem Fates" (VG)
• Cammy in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
• Carl Clover in "BlazBlue" (VG)
• Catalina in "Granblue Fantasy" (VG)
• Chidori Yoshino in "Persona 3" (VG)
• Elizabeth in "Persona 3" (VG)
• Raiden Mei in "Honkai Impact 3rd" (VG)
• Raiden Shogun/Raiden Ei in ”Genshin Impact" (VG)
• Acheron in "Honkai Star Rail" (VG)
• Jolyne Cujoh in "JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Eyes of Heaven" (VG)
• Twilight Sparkle in "My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic/Equestria Girls" (animated cartoon & movies)
• Makoto Makimura in "Yakuza 0/Kiwami 2" (VG)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/koge_dobo) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=106417) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/kogedobo.bsky.social)

In April 2008, Koge-Donbo changed her pen-name by adding an asterisk (`*`) at the end. She is now known as Koge-Donbo*.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/265406784) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tetsuro.araki.75)

Joined [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) in 1999 as a production manager, making his storyboard and episode director debut with [Galaxy Angel](https://anilist.co/anime/383/) just two years later. In 2005, he made his proper directorial debut with [Otogi-juushi Akazukin](https://anilist.co/anime/402/), a single-episode OVA which was aimed more at figure collectors than at anime fans. Its popularity birthed the full-length series and manga which both came out afterwards.

In 2006, Araki helmed his first big project with [Death Note](https://anilist.co/anime/1535/), which gained him international praise. He has since gone on to direct numerous series from originals such as [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Kabaneri of the Iron Fortress](https://anilist.co/anime/21196/), to the massively successful adaptation of [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/), whose production Araki left with the studio change.

He's been close friends with [Takayuki Hirao](https://anilist.co/staff/102247/) since their days at [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). The two have frequently collaborated on numerous projects.

Married to [Aya Hida](https://anilist.co/staff/144626/).

Freelance, however primarily works at [WIT Studio](https://anilist.co/studio/858/) with Animation Producer [Kazuki Yamanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/196459/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/265406784) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/tetsuro.araki.75)

Joined [MADHOUSE](https://anilist.co/studio/11/MADHOUSE) in 1999 as a production manager, making his storyboard and episode director debut with [Galaxy Angel](https://anilist.co/anime/383/) just two years later. In 2005, he made his proper directorial debut with [Otogi-juushi Akazukin](https://anilist.co/anime/402/), a single-episode OVA which was aimed more at figure collectors than at anime fans. Its popularity birthed the full-length series and manga which both came out afterwards.

He has since gone on to direct numerous series from originals such as [Guilty Crown](https://anilist.co/anime/10793/) and [Kabaneri of the Iron Fortress](https://anilist.co/anime/21196/), to the massively successful adaptation of [Attack on Titan](https://anilist.co/anime/16498/), whose production Araki left with the studio change.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/805696106420060160) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/78JmbZfna6DOfhSoxccZZw)

Masuda is perhaps best known as the composer of the 2002 hit anime series [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) where he combined traditional instruments like the shamisen and shakuhachi together with guitar, drums, bass, piano and other keyboard instruments along with chanting. Masuda also created the scores for titles such as [Mushishi](https://anilist.co/anime/457/), [Kamisama Kiss](https://anilist.co/anime/14713/) and [Ghost Hunt](https://anilist.co/anime/1571/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sushio_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/sushiogumicompany/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%99%E3%81%97%E3%81%8A)

Ishizaki Toshio, better known as Sushio, is an animator, illustrator and character designer working for [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).

After graduating from Yoyogi Animation Academy, he joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/). He debuted as an in-betweener in [Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/), as a key animator on [Berserk](https://anilist.co/anime/33/), and as an animation director on [Mahoromatic](https://anilist.co/anime/276/). In 2007, he served as a character designer for the first time on [Kiss Dum: Engage Planet](https://anilist.co/anime/2106/). He was a key staff member at Gainax for a long time, but left in 2011 when [Hiroyuki Imaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/97349/) and others established the anime production company Trigger. There he was given the job of handling the character designs for [Kill la Kill](https://anilist.co/anime/18679/), the first TV series produced by the newly-found studio.

Specializes in action and effects, and his skills attract a lot of attention in the industry.

Took part as a key animator on Quentin Tarantino's "Kill Bill: Vol. 1" in 2003.

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.

Thomas Gustafsson, professionally known as Thomas G:son, is a Swedish composer and musician born in Skövde, Västergötland.

He is best known for the 99 songs he has written for the national selections of 12 countries for the Eurovision Song Contest: 61 for Sweden, 11 for Spain, six for Norway, five for Denmark and Finland, three for Georgia, two each for Poland and Malta, and one each for Cyprus, Latvia, Romania and Belgium. He reached the milestone of 60 entries at Melodifestivalen at the 2020 edition. His songs have also reached the Eurovision Song Contest 15 times, four times for Sweden, three times each for Spain and Georgia, twice for Cyprus and once each for Norway, Denmark and Malta.  One of his song written for Sweden, "Listen to Your Heartbeat" would later get cover by the Japanese idol group Prière. This would later go on to be the first opening to Di Gi Charat Nyo. In 2012, G:son achieved his first victory as a winning composer at the Eurovision Song Contest with "Euphoria", performed by Loreen. He would later get his second victory when Loreen won with "Tattoo" won in 2023.

Gustafsson has been a full-time songwriter since 1998. In addition to writing and composing songs in various genres for a living, he is the guitarist of the hard rock band Masquerade.
Prière is a five-member female idol group from the performing arts school "Madison Music Academy Fukuoka", which has its main school in Kurume City, Fukuoka Prefecture.
